posts.com:
This board is dedicated to the discussion of history and the other humanities such as philosophy, religion, law, classical artwork, archeology, anthropology, ancient languages, etc. Please use /lit/ for discussions of literature. Threads should be about specific topics, and the creation of "general" threads is discouraged.

For the purpose of determining what is history, please do not start threads about events taking place less than 25 years ago. Historical discussions should be focused on past events, and not their contemporary consequences. Discussion of modern politics, current events, popular culture, or other non-historical topics should be posted elsewhere. General discussions about international culture should go on /int/.

/his/ is not /pol/, and Global Rule #3 is in effect. Do not try to treat this board as /pol/ with dates. Blatant racism and trolling will not be tolerated, and a high level of discourse is expected. History can be examined from many different conflicting viewpoints; please treat other posters with respect and address the content of their post instead of attacking their character.

When discussing history, please reference credible source material, and provide as much supporting information as possible in your posts.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Atlantis is not a metaphor. It is a myth based loosely on Akrotiri, the Minoans and partly confused with the sea peoples. Many details fit, the red, black and white layers of stone, hot and cold running water, concentric circle shape of the island (as it was before the eruption, confirmed by geology). Akrotiri was a Minoan resort island for the elite that turned out to be a volcano which erupted marking the end of Minoan hegemony fitting the general storyline. Plato says Solon visited Egypt and they recounted how they defeated the "Atlanteans", which is similar to their account of the sea peoples.

Inexplicable details like the 9000 year date must be mistranslations or errors. The timekeeping would have to be done through oral history and since Plato is the sole source of this date that casts doubt on his testimony.

Dogger bank and the mid Atlantic rift are too deep. The Richat structure is too high. Tartessus barely fits any of the details in the Atlantis myth besides being beyond the "Gates of Hercules".

Atlantis is based on memories from the bronze age, of Minoans, Mycenaeans and sea peoples and their various bronze age shenanigans.

>The power came forth out of the Atlantic Ocean, for in those days the Atlantic was navigable; and there was an island situated in front of the straits which are by you called the Pillars of Heracles; the island was larger than Libya and Asia put together, and was the way to other islands, and from these you might pass to the whole of the opposite continent which surrounded the true ocean; for this sea which is within the Straits of Heracles is only a harbour, having a narrow entrance, but that other is a real sea, and the surrounding land may be most truly called a boundless continent. Now in this island of Atlantis there was a great and wonderful empire which had rule over the whole island and several others, and over parts of the continent, and, furthermore, the men of Atlantis had subjected the parts of Libya within the columns of Heracles as far as Egypt, and of Europe as far as Tyrrhenia. This vast power, gathered into one, endeavoured to subdue at a blow our country and yours and the whole of the region within the straits; and then, Solon, your country shone forth, in the excellence of her virtue and strength, among all mankind. She was pre-eminent in courage and military skill, and was the leader of the Hellenes. And when the rest fell off from her, being compelled to stand alone, after having undergone the very extremity of danger, she defeated and triumphed over the invaders, and preserved from slavery those who were not yet subjugated, and generously liberated all the rest of us who dwell within the pillars. But afterwards there occurred violent earthquakes and floods; and in a single day and night of misfortune all your warlike men in a body sank into the earth, and the island of Atlantis in like manner disappeared in the depths of the sea. For which reason the sea in those parts is impassable and impenetrable, because there is a shoal of mud in the way; and this was caused by the subsidence of the island.

Plato, Timaeus/Critias

"capitalism" is competition of private capital. This system drives costs down as companies innovate, make huge profits, and others jump in to compete for that profit. Eventually driving the cost to as close to zero as possible.

North America was more thinly populated, and there weren't that many natives to begin with. American Indians in the north were mostly hunter-gatherers and nomadic farmers, so it was much more difficult to turn them into a serf class. They didn't like farming, it didn't come to them naturally. In central and south America where the population was much heavier and the Indians had been settled agriculturalists for generations, the pattern was pretty much the same as in Africa, with a small elite of white colonists ruling over masses of natives.
Africa also had a lot of diseases that wreaked havoc on whites and made mass settlement impractical, while the Americas mostly didn't.

>>14520389
>In the Americas it seems they were treated as a nuisance and the goal was to simply get them off the land so Europeans could settle there instead, and they ended up nearly exterminated and confined to reservations.
The original slave trade in North American colonies was in Indians. The English colonies were commercial entities and slavery massively cut labour costs, but the problem was that there wasn't enough Indians and they kept dying of diseases whenever they were in captivity for too long. That's why they started importing African slaves who had resistance to Old World diseases and who could easily be bought from trade emporiums that Europeans already set up in west Africa.
>Was this just the colonizers seeing Africa more as a place to cheaply extract resources from than to perform any sort of long-term settlement? What made their goals so different? Why is South Africa 87% black/colored while the United States is only 2% native American?
More or less. Africa was only carved up in like 1880 while there had been European settlements in the Americas since the late 1500s. The initial European settlement of the Americas also coincides with the reformation/counterreformation and religious wars in Europe, which gave an incentive to the various kingdoms to exile dissident sects to the new world. By the 1880s this isn't the case anymore and the European countries are nation states trying to industrialize their economy to the fullest extent. This means keeping their citizens within its borders as skilled workers in factories, and extracting resources like wood, iron, coal, rubber and oil from colonies to fuel that economy. Another factor is that African societies had much denser populations and the disparity in technology between the two wasn't as big as that between Europeans and Indians. This gave the colonialists the incentive to incorporate local elites into their economic structure as delegated bosses rather than trying to exterminate them all.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>14520402
>French
The French initially used their colonies as simple trading posts to buy high value furs from Native groups in exchange for metal tools, alcohol, guns etc. They were generally friendly to any group that would peacefully trade with them and made alliances with some like the Huron when they bordered hostiles like the Iroquois. When they decided to really settle New France in response to intensive English settlement in New England, they basically tried to recreate the feudal system of France in Canada and it didn't work out too well. The way they parcelled out the land wasn't very economically productive and because agricultural land had to be leased from a lord to his peasants, settlers couldn't expand wherever they wanted and there wasn't any economic incentive to develop your own land except to pay your rent and tithe and have enough to eat. The French have always been more diplomatic colonisers and focused on creating alliances with natives and turning their elites into Frenchmen. In Africa their colonial policy was essentially to educate Africans as Frenchmen so that they had an incentive to keep the empire together and continue France's exploitation of their country's resources. This is arguably the most effective form of colonisation because France is the only European country that really still has a colonial empire in Africa.

"The expedition traveled north, exploring Florida's West Coast, and encountering native ambushes and conflicts along the way. Hernando de Soto army seized the food stored in the villages, captured women to be used as slaves for the soldiers sexual gratification, and forced men and boys to serve as guides and bearers.

The army fought two battles with Timucua groups, resulting in heavy Timucua casualties. After defeating the resisting Timucuan warriors, Hernando de Soto had 200 executed, in what was to be called the Napituca Massacre"

"De Soto turned south toward the Gulf of Mexico to meet two ships bearing fresh supplies from Havana. De Soto demanded women and servants, and when Tuskaloosa refused, the European explorers took him hostage. The expedition began making plans to leave the next day, and Tuskaloosa gave in to de Soto's demands, providing bearers for the Spaniards.

He informed de Soto that they would have to go to his town of Mabila (or Mauvila), a fortified city in southern Alabama, to receive the women. De Soto gave the chief a pair of boots and a red cloak to reward him for his cooperation.

The Mobilian tribe, under chief Tuskaloosa, ambushed de Soto's army. Other sources suggest de Soto's men were attacked after attempting to force their way into a cabin occupied by Tuskaloosa.

The Spaniards fought their way out, and retaliated by burning the town to the ground. During the nine-hour encounter, about 200 Spaniards died, and 150 more were badly wounded, according to the chronicler Elvas.

Twenty more died during the next few weeks.

They killed an estimated 2,000-6,000 warriors at Mabila, making the battle one of the bloodiest in recorded North American history."

De Soto died of a fever on 21 May, 1542, in the native village of Guachoya

There are few authentic Templar places left in their homeland, France – it’s almost as if every trace of them has been wiped out, but this chapel somehow survived. >>14515475
The naming of the polity known to historians as the "Byzantine empire" changed a lot over time. Here follows how it was historically referred to:
395 AD "Eastern Roman empire": Theodosius the great divided the empire between his two sons. The term "Eastern empire" is accurate considering that the Notitia calls it the "pars orientalis".
476 AD "Roman empire": the Western Roman empire is disbanded by Odoacer, who sends the imperial regalia to Zeno. Some people have misinterpreted this event as a sort of "barbarian" conquest of Rome. In reality Odoacer considered himself a part of the Roman empire, I.E. Italy didn't stop being part of the Roman empire. The only thing that changed here is that the subdivision between West and East ceased. Thus, going forward, there was just one empire with its capital in Constantinople.
497 AD "Eastern Roman empire" (?): Theodoric the great received the imperial regalia back from Constantinople. We can't know for sure, but it's possible that the division of Western and Eastern empire was resumed, with Theodoric named as Western Roman emperor.
533 AD "Roman empire": Justinian's war with the Vandals asserted the notion, in Constantinople, that the territories in the West had been taken away from the Roman empire by barbarian usurpers. Thus, if the idea of Western and Eastern empire was indeed resumed under Theodoric's reign, that was taken down for good under Justinian. We can be sure that from this point onward, the peoples of Western Europe referred to the empire of Constantinople as the Roman empire.
797 AD: with the death of Constantine VI, murdered by his own mother, Irene, arises the controversy over the legitimacy of this polity. The people of Constantinople would continue to refer to their realm as the "Roman empire" until 1453, while the Westerners would start calling it the "Greek empire".
Choose yourself which view is better, but this is when the division starts, not with Heraclius or the death of Justinian.

The emperors in Constantinople were Greek. What's your point here? The idea that the emperor of the Roman empire had to be of Roman ethnicity isn't historical. After the reign of Commodus we start seeing lots of emperors who aren't of fully Roman stock. The Severans were half-Punic and towards the late third century and early fourth most emperors were Illyrians.
Justinian himself was an Illyrian too. But unlike Charlemagne, who was partially descended from the Roman aristocracy in Gallia, Justinian was a pig farmer with no filial ties to the Roman aristocracy, if he actually had any Roman ancestors at all.
>his empire was created new
From lands which were historically part of the Roman empire, including Italy itself. The people back then never stopped considering those lands as part of the empire, which had evolved into a joint cultural idea in the absence of an actual unified polity.
The view of the Western Europeans in the year 800 was that the office of Roman emperor had been vacant since the murder of Constantine VI, and that empress Irene was illegitimate and uncapable of protecting her subjects (considering that she didn't help the Pope protect Rome from the Lombards). There was a need for a Roman emperor to be crowned, and Charlemagne was the perfect fit, considering that he ruled huge swathes of land which were part of the empire, and was well respected by all the surrounding Christian monarchs, who nominally recognized him as their superior.

Essentially the Japanese military was in a civil war of sorts. The army wanted to attack the USSR and expand into China, while the Imperial navy wanted to expand into SSA. Their industrial base was too small to cover both campaigns.
>The long-term discord between the Imperial Japanese Army and Imperial Japanese Navy was one of the most notorious examples of interservice rivalry. The situation, with its origin traced back to the Meiji period, came with both geopolitical and military consequences leading to Japan's involvement in World War II. The IJA/IJN rivalry expressed itself in the early 1930s as the "strike north" (Hokushin-ron) and "strike south" (Nanshin-ron) factions. The goal of both factions was to seize territories which possessed the raw materials, especially petroleum, which Japan needed to sustain its growth and economy, but which it did not possess itself. The strike north faction advocated the taking of the natural resources of Siberia, by way of Manchuria, a scenario in which the prime role would be taken by the Army, the strike south faction advocated the taking of the oil-rich Dutch East Indies, a scenario in which the Navy would predominate.

>In order to further their own faction, relatively junior officers resorted to the assassinations of members of the rival faction and their supporters in government. With both factions being opposed to the peace faction, this period has become known as the era of "government by assassination". Insubordination by the Kwantung Army led first to the occupation of Manchuria, and later the Second Sino-Japanese War following the Marco Polo Bridge Incident. However, at the Battles of Khalkhin Gol, any farther expansion northwards into Siberia was shown to be impossible given the Soviet superiority in numbers and armour.

The border conflicts also proved that the flat, open terrain of Manchuria/the eastern steppe made the Soviet's doctrine of mobile, combined arms operational warfare vastly superior to whatever the Japanese army could scrape together. While the Japs had some cavalry divisions and infantry supported by some light tanks and armoured cars, the Soviet doctrine was based around combined arms assaults followed by breakthroughs of armoured and motorized units into the enemy rear to cut infantry off from supply. That is to say, that Japanese industry wasn't up to task with equipping and supplying their army to fight toe-to-toe battles against a modern mechanized enemy, and in retrospect it was probably a better decision to use their forces to bog down American troops on island hopping and mopping up campaigns.

Pre-implantation Genetic Screening (PGS) IVF in Korea
PGS or Preimplantation Genetic Screening has several restrictions in Korea. Using PGS, couples can ensure that their embryos are chromosomally normal prior to embryo transfer with IVF. While anyone can use PGS in order to ensure that only chromosomally normal embryos are transferred during an IVF cycle, PGS is often used for older couples who have an elevated risk of chromosomally abnormal embryos. Likewise, couples with a history of miscarriages often utilize PGS to decrease the risk of miscarrying.

>>14519712
1.) No
2.) Yes

God saves those whom He has predestined unto eternal life. His own good pleasure is the cause of their election, their conversion, their repentance, and their receiving the benefits of Christ's atonement (i.e. justification, adoption, sanctification, glorification).

Regardless of whether God chooses to extend that grace, man is still held accountable for his sin and unbelief. Why? Because God is sovereign over all Creation and those beings that inhabit His world and partake of its blessings are obliged to render unto their Creator that which He demands; namely, the exercise of righteous living and fruitful stewardship over the earth. The conscience of man acts even when there is no formally promulgated law, and serves as a binding witness against us when we transgress it. Thus, all men are culpable before God and owe Him satisfaction for the offense to His Holiness that our sin constitutes.

Bottom line? Grace is God's discretionary exercising of favor towards objects of mercy prepared for in advance. Wrath is the consequent outworking of God's immutable justice towards all those who hear the gospel call and reject His command for them to repent. The strawman that usually prevails in these discussions is one in which man is wholly neutral and dearly wishing to be saved and God arbitrarily acts to prevent that. But the Scriptures teach that apart from the intervening action of God in giving man a new heart and a new spirit, man is unwilling to depart from his sin and consequently suppresses the truth of Christ. Hence, the majority of mankind is self-condemned.

posts.com:
Historical denialism is more prevalent in the East where history didn't really start until the west exported it in the 18th century. You can see this in Russia where most of the english-language history denial exists, since Russia has a lot of eastern influence and eastern thinking within it. In previous eras, history would more or less reset with every new king/ruler/monarchy as major wars would almost always successfully destroy all previous records. This is why our understanding of the pre-modern world is so patchwork and based off church texts, as the western church wasn't itself a target for war until the renaissance when literacy and printing were increasingly commonplace. Reading in general is key to this and, especially in say china or india, reading was only something men did and even the only the sons who were groomed/sent to be the clan's representative in the local government. It's much easier to just erase large parts of history this way as there is no central authority or shared appreciation for writing as there is in the west.

For example how many records of Soviet computers were kept? The best records outside of the Lenin Institute were bombed by Russia in Mariupol. Thus, much of Soviet computing history has been lost - or at least the parts that Russia won't censor. Same for the Vietnam War, records concerning which would have been destroyed by the Nixon Admin had Daniel Ellsberg not leaked them. Or perhaps the entire history of Labor and Socialism in America, which is kept alive through hobbyists and lawyers as the government does not recognize it as a subject worth of study.

If Athens and Rome are where Western civilization is founded then Christianity is a foreign imposition. If, however, Jerusalem is where Western civilization was founded, then Westerners in Christianity are actually the foreign imposition. Which you pick is dependent upon your ideological priors; for example, Communists argue "Jerusalem", Fascists argue "Athens/Greece".

All of Western history since Christianity came along has been an argument over whether Athens/Rome or Jerusalem are the centers of Western civilization. The Classical period was obviously "Athens/Rome", Medieval period was a firm "Jerusalem", the Renaissance moved it to "Athens/Rome", Modernism moved it back to "Jerusalem" (by applying Deconstructionism and Judaeo-Bolshevism to "Athens/Rome" thus arguing for "Jerusalem" by proxy), we're seeing an increasing shift back to "Athens/Rome" as people get sick of Jews and Christianity.

In the case of China, I think it's more important to note that we have heavily biased propaganda narratives, not necessarily a "lack of information". Archaeological evidence points to China more or less being the same from 1000BC up until the early 1900sAD. It's everything before the mass adoption of rice feudalism that gets blurry. I think if we got detailed records of the Zhou dynasty by some miracle, it wouldn't really be all the more interesting than the semi-mythological royal dynasties that we have now make it out to be. King Chung overthrow King Wu, who inherited from King Tu, etc. But that period at the adoption of rice farming and feudalism, THAT would be interesting.

My vision:

-Charles would not have inherited Castile or Aragon.
-The Castilians would have focused on their overseas empire as Spain did at XVIII century after losing Naples and Netherlands.
-The deterioration of medieval institutions would have accelerated by not having mutilated the Castilian bourgeoisie as occurred during the rebellion of the Comuneros.
-France would have annexed Aragon, Naples, Sardinia and Navarra.

-The Catholic Church and the HRE would have gone down in history as a medieval relic that died with Luther.
-Castile would have ended up annexing Portugal.

posts.com:
Despite a West German bounty for his capture and Mossad efforts to catch him after the capture of Adolf Eichmann in Buenos Aires, Mengele evaded capture. He spent his latter days in Sao Paolo, Brazil in a rented bungalow. Rolf Mengele visited his father at the bungalow in 1977, having last seen him 21 years earlier. Rolf reported that the "doctor of death" was an unrepentant Nazi who maintained that he had done nothing wrong and was merely carrying out orders.

Mengele was suffering from high blood pressure in his last years and he drowned after having a stroke while swimming at the beach in Bertioga on February 7, 1979. His body was buried in Embu das Artes under the name "Wolfgang Gerhard", whose identification Mengele had been using since 1971.

The outside world did not know of his death until 1985 however. Worldwide interest in the case was heightened by a mock trial held in Jerusalem that February, featuring the testimonies of over 100 victims of Mengele's experiments. Shortly afterwards, the West German, Israeli, and U.S. governments launched a coordinated effort to determine Mengele's whereabouts. The West German and Israeli governments offered rewards for his capture, as did The Washington Times and the Simon Wiesenthal Center.

Brazilian authorities exhumed Mengele's remains in June and stated that they were "extremely likely" to be his. Rolf Mengele confirmed that his father had been dead for six years. The skeleton is now stored at the University of Sao Paolo Medical School and used as an educational aid there.

The problem is that anything that gives you pleasure can also become addicting, especially if you're lacking in "normal" happiness. So "deviant moderation" is something of a myth. If you decide "I'm going to smoke crack cocaine on Sundays but go clean the other days" or "I'll only have one massive 5-hour gangbang orgy every month, otherwise I'll be celibate" you're just increasing the chance it becomes an addiction. If you even have the compulsion to do some degenerate thing for pleasure, it's because you lack pleasure in the rest of your life. So, to live a good and most pleasurable life, you should see to making yourself happy by yourself--pick up a skillful pastime, enjoy nature and the outdoors, surround yourself with friends. That's a normal life, and it doesn't need "moderation".

>Inbreeding will make your kids deformed.
The deformities we are discussing now are primarily caused by deleterious recessive alleles, and such alleles have a 6.25% chance of being expressed in siblings, 4% in first cousins, and 2% in people of the same ethnicity.
And not to mention the fact that inbreeding actually purifies the gene pool and purges such deleterious alleles as well as bad genes, making your offspring more genetically fit for the environment.
To quote Glemin (2003), "it is well established that consanguineous mating can purge a part of the mutation load" and "nonrandom mating (meaning consanguineous mating) can purge deleterious mutations regardless of their dominance level."
And lastly, this argument is an utter shit argument because racemixing, where your offspring are guaranteed to become genetic nightmares that are not suited for any kinds of environments and weak to many kinds of diseases from physical to mental, retarded breeding, where your offspring are also guaranteed to be retarded but not 100%, and homosexuality, where STDs and abuse are rampant (same for racemixing too), are legal and encouraged..

>your biologically programmed to avoid inbreeding
Just a few research on Roman Egypt pretty much reveal that humans are biologically more inclined to mate with their sisters than random whores.
So yeah, it's also bullshit.

Malian democracy was hugely corrupt with a whole political class dependent on securing donor aid rather than being responsive to the needs of its citizens. Donor aid often came with conditions such as cutting government spending and liberalising the economy so that Mali was able to draw less income from taxation and became increasinly removed from the lives of citizens.

Most Malians grew disillusioned with the government that they saw as increasingly corrupt and did nothing for them. This was especially the case under Amadou Toumani Toure, who bascially bought off political opposition and used corruption as a tool of patronage.

In the North the Tuaregs and Arabs felt that none of thier grievances were adressed and that they were shut out of government. The Sahel droughts had wiped out the traditional pastoracl economy and tourism was dying due to insecurity. This meant that smuggling became the main source of income in the north, especially of drugs. ATT's governemnt tolerated this and used it as a political resource to reward loyal Tuareg and Arab militias. This fed disillusionment in the North.

Since the 2000's, Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb used Northern Mali as a reserve base, then later got involved in smuggling and kidknapping to raise revenue. ATT ignored the issue so long as AQIM did not target Mali. AQIM uses its wealthy to recruit Malians and ally with the tribes in the north, funding health clinics, marrying locally ect. This helps cement its presence and helped spawn its off shoots the Movement of Oneness and Jihad in West Africa (MUJAO) and Ansar Dine

In 2012 Tuareg mercs fighting for Ghaddafi return to northern Mali with heavy weapons and ally with former Tuareg rebels to create the Movement for the National liberation of Azawad (MNLA) which seeks to create a secular Tuareg state in the north. They also ally with the Jihadists because they need their muscle.

Rebels begin rebellion in 2012, the Malian army does poorly due to years of neglect and corruption. This leads to the military coup in March that ousts ATT. This results in a collapse of organisation in the North and the rebels are able to seize the whole of Northern Mali.

The Islamic Republic of Azawad is declared, representing a compromise between the MNLA's demand for an independent state and Jihadists demand for and Islamic one. The united government quickly collapses and the Jihadists are able to push out the MNLA due to being stronger. The Jihadists also enjoy more support from the non Tuareg population in the north (Songhais and Fulani) who don't wan't a seperate state and because they were seen as providing better law and order and service than the MNLA. After taking full control, the Jihadists begin implementing full Shariah and destroying many sufi shrines as shirk.

In the South, thier is pressure on the military to hand over control as soon as possible, as well as tenatives efforts at negotiation with the rebels through Ansar Dine, which is seen as a possible moderate force. France, Algeria and neighbouring west african states are concerned with a Jihadist state in the middle of the Sahara and begin to push for and invtervention. By January Jihadists launch a renewed offensive on the south to conquer the rest of Mali. France intervenes with operation Barkhane and is able to repel the Jihadist attacl, and then push them out of the North.

Most of the Jihadist retreat into the desert rather than fight and many Tuaregs defect.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>14519524
After Barkhane. The French stay on in Mali in operation Serval. They are also assisted by the UN mission to Mali (MINUSMA) and the deployment of West African soldiers under the G5 Sahel. Much of Northern Mali comes under the control of militias that form two coalitions, Platforme (pro Mali) and the High Council of Azawad (pro autonamy). The Malian government has an extremely weak presence and the North remains insecure.

The Jihadist regoup in the desert and begin to wage a guerilla/terrorist insurgency. Ansar Dine and AQIM survive, while MUJAO mergers with AQIM defectors to create al Murabitoun.

The centre of violence increasinly shifts to central Mali after 2015 with the emergence of Katiba Macina, a Jihadist group consisting of Fulani's from Mopti and Segou regions. Some Fulani joined the Jihadists in 2012/2013 for protection against the MNLA and bandits, and the Malian army targets them during the reconquest. Central Mali turns into an ethnic war with the Malian army supporting militias from farming communities called Dozo's against the Fulani, with the Kataiba Macina acting as a defence of Fulani pastoralists.

By 2015 defectors from al Murabitoun pledge allegiance to IS and form Islamic State in Greater Sahara. They operate on the borderlands of Mali-Niger and Burkina Faso, bringing the insurgency to neighbouring countries. Another groups called Ansaroul Sunna forms in Burkina Faso around 2015 under similar conditions as Katiba Macina.

Around 2017 most Jihadist groups unify under a new umbrella group called Jamaat Nusrat Islam wal Muslimeen, which pledges allegiance to al Qaeda. They continue to wage an inssurgency agaonst the Malian government and foreign forces. By 2019 JNM and ISGS begin to fight each other for supremacy in the Sahel as well.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>14519532
Modern Y-haplo data that match well with historical records from later dynasties. Y-chromosomal analyses can tell you the most common ancestor of a group of people at a given historical period. It can also tell you for any given ancestor how many male offspring with surviving lineage exist. You can compare the number of children with historical records. Generally the more surviving lineage, the more noble/royal an ancestor was.
For example 8% of people with Liu surname in China share a common ancestor O-F254 (formed 2300 years ago), and it's also the most common ancestor from the same historical period among people with Liu surname. O-F254 has 29 branches, meaning that ancestor had at least 29 sons who had offspring surviving to this day.
O-F254 corresponds to Liu Taigong (282BC-197BC), Liu Bang's father. Liu Bang was the founder of Western Han dynasty.
Similarly O-F254's offspring, O-F813 (formed 2200 years ago and has 41 branches) corresponds to Liu Qi (188BC-141BC, Emperor Jing of Western Han).
O-F813's offspring, O-Y20928 (formed 2000 years ago and has 29 branches) corresponds to Liu Xiu (5BC-57AD, founder of Eastern Han dynasty)
Around 2% of all people in China have actual Liu Han heritage, and it's also the most common ancestor from the same historical period among all people in China.
